intro: Spermacoce leptoloba, commonly known as the slender false sandmat, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are shrubs or herbs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in cymes, and its fruit is a schizocarp consisting of two one-seeded segments. Spermacoce leptoloba is characterized by its slender, upright stems and trifoliate leaves, which are opposite or whorled along the stem. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and woodland edges.
